column4: Hi, I want to change my grub boot order, but I don't have  /boot/grub/menu.lst. Is there any other file?
edit /etc/default/grub, set the DEFAULT value and run "sudo update-grub" then.
: umm where I can find the list? To know which number I want to put
I assume the order they come out is the order number?
So I can just rsync the old disk with the new one and change the mount point of / ?
yes, you have to change UUID for / and rewrite grub
you have to write into the MBR of the new disk to boot from it
So basically I need to install / move grub to the new disk right?
yes, copy your filesystems, change /etc/fstab for the new UUIDs and then rewrite grub using chroot or live-cd
Oh. Using live cd seems easier. :) Thanks for the help.
